In a perfect world, we will answer four questions about a putative transfusion-transmitted agent before recipients are infected to prospectively inform consideration, development, and deployment of mitigation strategies [ 11].
Is the agent present in the blood of otherwise qualified donors?
Is the agent parenterally transmissible (by blood, organ/tissue transplantation), or is such transmission biologically plausible?
Will the agent survive in contemporary blood components to be transmitted?
Does the agent, if transmitted, pose a material clinical risk after transfusionâ€”Does it cause significant illness among susceptible transfusion recipients?
